typeDescription: Model information for a resin reagent used as support in solid phase synthesis or in chromatography.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of this Object.

fields.name: ID
fields.description: ID of this Object.

fields.name: Object
fields.description: Object of this Object.

metadata.value: The object reference of this object.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Type of this Object.

fields.name: Notebook
fields.description: Notebook this object belongs to.

fields.name: Synonyms
fields.description: List of possible alternative names this model goes by.

fields.name: Authors
fields.description: The people who created this model.

fields.name: CAS
fields.description: Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) registry number for the resin.

fields.name: IUPAC
fields.description: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) name for the resin.

fields.name: ResinFunction
fields.description: The intended purpose of the resin, whether that be solid state synthesis or chromatography.

fields.name: Molecule
fields.description: The chemical representation of this molecule.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The physical state of a pure sample of this resin at room temperature and pressure.

fields.name: FunctionalGroup
fields.description: The functional group displayed on the resin.

fields.name: AffinityLabel
fields.description: Indicates if this Resin has AffinityLabels.

fields.name: AffinityLabels
fields.description: The affinity tag(s) conjugated to the resin.

fields.name: DetectionLabel
fields.description: Indicates if this Resin has DetectionLabels.

fields.name: DetectionLabels
fields.description: The detection molecules used to identify the resin.

fields.name: Labels
fields.description: The combined set of AffinityLabels and DetectionLabels.

fields.name: MultiplexELISAUse
fields.description: Indicates if this Resin is being used for ExperimentMultiplexELISA.

fields.name: IncompatibleResins
fields.description: A list of resin identity models this resin/antibody pair cannot share a cocktail with.

fields.name: ParticleSize
fields.description: The size of the particles that make up the resin packing material.

fields.name: PoreSize
fields.description: The average size of the pores within the resin packing material.

fields.name: StructureImageFile
fields.description: The image depicting the chemical structure of the resin's functional group.

fields.name: ResinMaterial
fields.description: The molecular structure of the resin.

fields.name: Linker
fields.description: The chemical entity used to link a compound to the resin bead during solid phase synthesis.

fields.name: Linkers
fields.description: The molecule version of the Linker described in the Linker field.

fields.name: Loading
fields.description: For each member of Labels, the ratio of active sites per weight of resin.

fields.name: ProtectingGroup
fields.description: The protecting group blocking the terminal reactive group on the resin used during solid phase synthesis.

fields.name: pH
fields.description: The logarithmic concentration of hydrogen ions of a pure sample of this molecule at room temperature and pressure.

fields.name: ChromatographyType
fields.description: The type of chromatography for which this resin is suitable for. HPLC, FPLC, Flash or SupercriticalFluidChromatography are options.

fields.name: SeparationMode
fields.description: The type of separation for which this resin is suitable for. Normal Phase, Reverse Phase, Ion Exchange, Size Exclusion, Affinity or Chiral are options.

fields.name: Magnetic
fields.description: Indicates if this resin has superparamagnetic properties that allow it to be separated from a suspension using a magnetic field.

fields.name: PackingBuffer
fields.description: The buffer used for packing the resin in the column.

fields.name: StorageBuffer
fields.description: The buffer used to keep the resin wet while the column is stored.

fields.name: PreferredCleavageMethod
fields.description: Method object containing the preferred parameters for cleaving synthesized strands from this resin.

fields.name: DefaultSampleModel
fields.description: Specifies the model of sample that will be used if this model is specified to be used in an experiment.

fields.name: PostCouplingKaiserResult
fields.description: The expected result of a Kaiser test following monomer download. This is used to determine if the resin contains deprotected primary amines (Positive).

fields.name: PostCappingKaiserResult
fields.description: The expected result of a Kaiser test following capping of downloaded resin. This is used to determine if the resin contains deprotected primary amines (Positive).

fields.name: Radioactive
fields.description: Indicates if this molecule emits substantial ionizing radiation.

fields.name: Ventilated
fields.description: Indicates if a pure sample of this molecule must be handled in a ventilated enclosures.

fields.name: Flammable
fields.description: Indicates if a pure sample of this molecule is easily set aflame at room temperature and pressure.

fields.name: Acid
fields.description: Indicates if pure samples of this molecule are strong acids (pH <= 2).

fields.name: Base
fields.description: Indicates if pure samples of this molecule are strong acids (pH >= 12).

fields.name: Pyrophoric
fields.description: Indicates if pure samples of this molecule can ignite spontaneously upon exposure to air.

fields.name: WaterReactive
fields.description: Indicates if pure samples of this molecule react spontaneously upon exposure to water.

fields.name: Fuming
fields.description: Indicates if pure samples of this molecule emit fumes spontaneously when exposed to air.

fields.name: HazardousBan
fields.description: Indicates this molecule is currently banned from usage in the ECL because the facility isn't yet equiped to handle it.

fields.name: ExpirationHazard
fields.description: Indicates if pure samples of this molecule become hazardous once they are expired and must be automatically disposed of when they pass their expiration date.

fields.name:
ParticularlyHazardous
Substance
fields.description: Indicates if special precautions should be taken in handling this molecule, as indicated by the MSDS classification.

fields.name: DrainDisposal
fields.description: Indicates if this molecule may be safely disposed down a standard drain.

fields.name: Pungent
fields.description: Indicates if pure samples of this molecule have a strong odor.

fields.name: MSDSRequired
fields.description: Indicates if an MSDS is required for this molecule.

fields.name: MSDSFile
fields.description: The PDF of the MSDS (Materials Saftey Data Sheet) of this molecule.

fields.name: NFPA
fields.description: The National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) 704 hazard diamond classification for this molecule.

fields.name: DOTHazardClass
fields.description: The Department of Transportation hazard classification for this molecule.

fields.name: BiosafetyLevel
fields.description: The Biosafety classification for this molecule.

fields.name: LightSensitive
fields.description: Indicates if this molecule reacts or degrades in the presence of light.

fields.name: IncompatibleMaterials
fields.description: A list of materials that would be damaged if wetted by this molecule.

fields.name: LiquidHandlerIncompatible
fields.description: Indicates if pure samples of this molecule cannot be reliably aspirated or dispensed on an automated liquid handling robot.

fields.name: PipettingMethod
fields.description: The pipetting parameters used to manipulate pure samples of this model.

fields.name: UltrasonicIncompatible
fields.description: Indicates if pure samples of this molecule cannot be performed via the ultrasonic distance method due to vapors interfering with the reading.

fields.name: MinTemperature
fields.description: The minimum temperature at which this resin can function.

fields.name: MaxTemperature
fields.description: The maximum temperature at which this resin can function.

fields.name: MinpH
fields.description: The minimum pH the resin can handle.

fields.name: MaxpH
fields.description: The maximum pH the resin can handle.
